article:
Night markets are one of the many joys about living in Taiwan. For some, it's all about the shopping, but I've never particularly   _  night market deals . Last night, a small group of us   _  a
visit to Taipei's most famous and biggest night market, the Shilin Night
Market.
I hadn't been here   _  1988,
and it hasn't changed a bit: still  _  with
people. If one doesn't like noise but wants a  _  of
the night market experience, he is advised to try a smaller,  _  famous one, or avoid weekends.
Night markets are a great place to   find out  the latest popular foods.  Right now  , believe it or
not, Indian kati rolls are very popular. Alibaba's Kitchen is an  _  popular place that makes kati rolls the old-fashioned way. The people
here are all Chinese, however, which may  explain  their
poor "Indian" English.
I'm not   _  eating
Chinese meat food, so I tried the vegetable one.  On the whole  the
kati roll was a disappointment,  _  the paratha,
another kind of Indian food, was excellent. It was too dry and basically only a
potato sandwich. It could have used a greater variety of   _  .
A friend told me that the   _  kati rolls in town are in the Xindian Night Market. I believe him,
because the man  _  them is an actual South
Asian,  _  has lived in Taiwan for years. I
walked  _  his stand when I was there last time, but was   _  busy to give it a try. I'm just looking for a  _  to go back.
